info.document:
The pair both uploaded an image of a rainbow armband ahead of the 'Come out for LGBT' campaign

Get football updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email

Manchester United and Arsenal head a Premier League contingent lending their support to the 'Come out for LGBT' campaign.

The campaign aims to show support for lesbian, gay, bi and trans players and fans.

United and the Gunners both uploaded an image of a rainbow-coloured armband to their social media accounts on Friday morning.

It follows on from last year's rainbow laces-themed activities across both professional and grass roots sports clubs.

The Premier League have been actively involved and featured the campaign last November.

Perimeter advertising and a giant Premier League Rainbow Laces flag to open games were amongst the additional acts of support.

In addition to Premier League Clubs, teams from the Championship, League One and League Two, English Football League, Premiership Rugby and Welsh Rugby were also involved.

The initiative follows Stonewall research that shows 72 per cent of football fans have heard homophobic abuse at grounds around the country.
